definition: slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)

sentences.english: It takes away our edge, makes us groggy, and disrupts our sleep.
sentences.chinese: 它讓我們反應遲鈍，頭昏腦脹，擾亂我們的睡眠。
悲傷使她變得遲鈍麻木了。

sentences.english: He has a keen impatience with the dull.
sentences.chinese: 他對於遲鈍的人極不耐煩。

sentences.english: Dully he concurs, till an idea glows.
sentences.chinese: 遲鈍地表示着同意，直到一計心生。

sentences.english: A person regarded as mentally dull; a dolt.
sentences.chinese: 被認爲遲鈍的或呆滯的人。

sentences.english: But far more common is mental slowness.
sentences.chinese: 但是更多的例子思維遲鈍。

sentences.english: At this time, she still only misses her diary, the obtuse fellow.
sentences.chinese: 都這個時候了，她還只想着她的日記，遲鈍的傢伙。

sentences.english: The vein outside skull and homonymic and arterial companion go, but slower to sense of pain.
sentences.chinese: 顱外靜脈與同名動脈伴行，但對痛覺較遲鈍。

sentences.english: Lack of sleep blunted her thinking.
sentences.chinese: 缺少睡眠使她的思想變得遲鈍。

sentences.english: "Close to a tipping point the system becomes more inert, " Scheffer said.
sentences.chinese: 系統接近轉折點時，會變得更加遲鈍。

sentences.english: Am I Am I retarded or am I just overjoyed?
sentences.chinese: 我是智力遲鈍，還是樂極生悲呢？

sentences.english: I love you in slow, dim-witted ways.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你，我的方式遲鈍而迂腐。

sentences.english: The scabbard is content to be dull when it protects the keenness of the sword.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘保護刀的鋒利，它自己則滿足於它的遲鈍。

sentences.english: The scabbard is content to the dull when it protects the keenness of the word.
sentences.chinese: 劍鞘保護着劍的鋒利，卻滿足於它自己的遲鈍。

sentences.english: The scabbard is content to be dull when it protects the keenness of the word。
sentences.chinese: 劍鞘保護劍的鋒利，自己卻滿足於它自己的遲鈍。

definition: to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
